TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirements of the experiment to know the name/ Click on “Continue” Button to start the experiment.
Determination of the Amount of Tris base for preparing 100ml of 1M Tris-Cl Buffer.
A blotting paper is taken from the work bench.
The blotting paper is placed on the weighing balance and tared it to zero.
A spatula is taken and is wiped with cotton.
The bottle having Tris base is opened and taken out some Tris base from it.
The Tris base is put into the Blotting paper placed over the weighing balance and adjusted the weight to 12.114g.
Weighed Tris base (12.114g) is taken out from the weighing balance. After that, it is closed.
The Tris base (12.114g) is transferred into a beaker labeled as Tris-Cl Buffer for its final preparation.
A measuring cylinder of 100ml is taken from the workbench.
A small amount of Distilled water is poured in to the measuring cylinder.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Again, small amount of Distilled water is taken from the bottle.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Approximately 80ml of Distilled water is poured into the measuring cylinder.
The measured Distilled water is transferred into the beaker, containing Tris base.
A glass rod is taken from the beaker.
The glass rod is wiped with cotton.
The solution in the beaker is mixed well with glass rod.
notext
The pH meter is switched on.
The pH value is already calibrated as 7.00 .The electrode is taken out from the stand and washed with distilled water (bottom working part).
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode (tip portion only) is dipped in to the Tris solution. The pH value is changed to 9.98 on the display.
The electrode is washed with distilled water.
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode is replaced into the stand.The pH value is again reached to 7.00 on the display.
A dropper is taken from the beaker and a bottle containing HCl (0.1M) is opened. A small amount of 1M Con.HCl is taken out from the bottle using the dropper.
1M Con.HCl is drop wisely and carefully added in to the Tris-Cl beaker (Mix the solution).
The electrode is taken out from the stand. The electrode is washed with distilled water (bottom working part).
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The pH value is observed as 8.00 on the display (thus the desired pH value is adjusted). After that the electrode is taken from the Tris-Cl solution.
The electrode is washed with distilled water.
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode is replaced into the stand.
A 100ml measuring cylinder is taken from the work bench.
A small amount of distilled water is poured into the measuring cylinder.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
The measuring cylinder is kept in the work bench.
The beaker containing Tris-Cl Buffer is taken from the work bench.
The Tris-Cl Buffer is poured into the 100ml measuring cylinder.
notext
A clean bottle (Labeled as 1M Tris-Cl Buffer) is taken for storage.
A clean bottle (Labeled as 1M Tris-Cl Buffer) is taken for storage.
The measuring cylinder with solution is taken from the work bench.
The volume of Tris-Cl Buffer is made up to the volume of 100ml by adding distilled water.
The bottle (Labeled as 1M Tris-Cl Buffer) is opened and transferred the Tris-Cl Buffer into it.
The bottle of 1M Tris-Cl Buffer is replaced into its original place.
The used 100ml measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
After washing, the measuring cylinder of 100ml is replaced into its original place.
After washing, the measuring cylinder of 100ml is replaced into its original place.
notext
Determination of the Amount of EDTA to prepare 100ml of 0.5M EDTA.
A spatula is taken and is wiped with cotton.
The bottle having EDTA is opened and taken out some EDTA from it.
EDTA is put into the Blotting paper placed over the weighing balance and adjusted the weight to 18.612g.
Weighed EDTA (18.612g) is taken out from the weighing balance. After that, it is closed.
The EDTA (18.612g) is transferred into a beaker (Labeled as 0.5M EDTA) for its final preparation.
A 100ml measuring cylinder is taken from the work bench.
A small amount of distilled water is poured into the measuring cylinder for washing it.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Approximately 80ml of Distilled water is poured into the measuring cylinder.
The measured Distilled water is transferred into the beaker, containing EDTA.
The beaker with EDTA and Distilled water is taken from the work bench.
The beaker with EDTA and Distilled water is placed over the magnetic stirrer.
A stir bar is taken from the watch glass using a forceps.
The stir bar is put in to the Beaker with EDTA and Distilled water and switch on the stirrer for mixing the solution.
notext
The pH meter is switched on.The pH value is already calibrated as 7.00.
The electrode is taken out from the stand and washed with distilled water (bottom working part).
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode (tip portion only) is dipped into the EDTA solution.The pH value is changed to 5.96 on the display.The electrode is taken out from the EDTA solution.
The electrode is washed with Distilled water.
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode is replaced into the stand.The pH value is again reached to 7.00 on the display.
A dropper is taken from the beaker and the NaOH bottle (1N) is opened. A small amount of 1N NaOH is taken out from the bottle using the dropper.
1N NaOH is drop wisely and carefully added in to 0.5 M EDTA beaker (Mix the solution).Then the EDTA is fully dissolved in Distilled water.
The electrode is taken out from the stand and washed with Distilled water (bottom working part).
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.

The electrode (tip portion only) is dipped into the EDTA solution.The pH value is observed as 8.00 on the display (thus the desired pH value is adjusted).The electrode is taken out from the EDTA solution.
The electrode is washed with distilled water.
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode is replaced into the stand.The pH value in the display is reached to 7.00 again.
The pH meter is switched off.
The magnetic stirrer is switched off.
A magnetic stirring bar retriever is taken from the beaker.
The stir bar is taken from the EDTA solution by the retriever.
The stir bar is put into a beaker.
The EDTA solution is taken from the magnetic stirrer.
The entire EDTA solution is transferred into the 100ml measuring cylinder.
notext
The final volume is made up to 100ml with Distilled water
A clean bottle (Labeled as 0.5M EDTA) is taken for storing the prepared 0.5M EDTA solution.
A clean bottle (Labeled as 0.5M EDTA) is taken for storing the prepared 0.5M EDTA solution.
The bottle is opened and 100ml of 0.5M EDTA solution is transferred into it.
The 0.5M EDTA bottle is replaced in to its original place.
The used 100ml measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
After washing, the 100ml measuring cylinder is replaced into its original place.
After washing, the 100ml measuring cylinder is replaced into its original place.
notext
notext
Requirements for the Preparation of TE buffer
Calculation for determining the volume of 1M Tris-Cl to convert it into 10mM in concentration (TE Buffer preparation requires 10mM Tris-Cl).
Calculation for determining the volume of 0.5M EDTA to convert it into 1mM in concentration (TE Buffer preparation requires 1mM EDTA).
A 10ml measuring cylinder is taken from the work bench.
A small amount of Distilled water is poured in to the measuring cylinder.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Again, small amount of Distilled water is taken from the bottle.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
The rinsed beaker is kept in the work bench.
Bottle containing 1M Tris-Cl Buffer is opened and taken from the work bench.
1M Tris-Cl Buffer is poured into the measuring cylinder up to the marking 10.
The Tris-Cl bottle (1M) is replaced into its original place and is closed well.
The measured 10ml 1M Tris-Cl is transferred into a beaker labeled as TE Buffer (which is used for TE Buffer preparation).
The measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
The measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
A 2ml pipette is taken from the rack and a pipette pump is inserted into it.
The bottle containing 0.5M EDTA is opened and pipette out 2ml from it.
2ml of 0.5M EDTA solution is transferred into the TE Buffer beaker.
A 1000ml measuring cylinder is taken from the work bench.
A small amount of Distilled water is poured in to the measuring cylinder.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Again, small amount of Distilled water is taken from the bottle.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Approximately 600ml of Distilled water is taken into the measuring cylinder.
Approximately 600ml of Distilled water is taken into the measuring cylinder.
The Distilled water is transferred into the beaker labeled as TE Buffer.
The measuring cylinder is kept in the work bench.
A glass rod is taken from the beaker.
The glass rod is wiped with cotton.
The solution in the beaker is mixed well with glass rod.
The 1000ml measuring cylinder is taken for Making up the final TE buffer volume to 1000ml.
The measuring cylinder is kept in the work bench for making the final volume of TE buffer to 1000ml.
The beaker with TE buffer is taken from the work bench.
TE Buffer is transferred into the 1000ml measuring cylinder.
A small volume of Distilled water is added into the beaker labeled as TE buffer for dissolving all the Buffer contents stuck on the sides of beaker.
The beaker is rinsed well.
The rinsed Distilled water is transferred in to the beaker.
notext
The Measuring cylinder with TE buffer is taken from the work bench.
The final volume of TE Buffer is made up to 1000ml with Distilled water.
The TE buffer is transferred into a bottle which is labeled as ‘TE Buffer’.
The 1000ml measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
After washing, the 1000ml measuring cylinder is replaced into its original place.
After washing, the 1000ml measuring cylinder is replaced into its original place.
notext
notext
Requirements for the Preparation of 5x TBE buffer
A spatula is taken and is wiped with cotton.
The bottle having Tris base is opened and taken out some Tris base from it.
The Tris base is put into the Blotting paper placed over the weighing balance and adjusted the weight to 54g.
Weighed Tris base (54g) is taken out from the weighing balance. After that, it is closed.
The Tris base (54g) is transferred into a beaker labeled as TBE Buffer for its final preparation.
Again a spatula is taken and is wiped with cotton.
The bottle having Boric acid is opened and taken out some Tris base from it.
The Boric acid is put into the Blotting paper placed over the weighing balance and adjusted the weight to 27.5g.
Weighed Boric acid (27.5g) is taken out from the weighing balance. After that, it is closed.
The Boric acid (27.5g) is transferred into a beaker (Labeled as TBE Buffer) for the final preparation of TBE Buffer.
A measuring cylinder of 25 ml is taken from the work bench.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Again, small amount of Distilled water is taken from the bottle.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
The measuring cylinder is kept in the work bench.
The bottle containing 0.5M EDTA is taken from the work bench.
20ml of 0.5M EDTA is measured in the measuring cylinder.
The EDTA bottle is replaced into the work bench.
The measured EDTA solution is transferred into the beaker labeled as TBE buffer.
The 25ml measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
After washing, the measuring cylinder is replaced into the work bench.
After washing, the measuring cylinder is replaced into the work bench.
A 1000ml measuring cylinder is taken from the work bench.
A small amount of Distilled water is poured in to the measuring cylinder.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Again, small amount of Distilled water is taken from the bottle.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Approximately 600ml of Distilled water is taken into the measuring cylinder.
Approximately 600ml of Distilled water is taken into the measuring cylinder.
The Distilled water is transferred into the beaker labeled as TBE Buffer.
The Measuring cylinder is replaced into the work bench.
A glass rod is taken from the beaker.
The glass rod is wiped with cotton.
The solution in the beaker is mixed well with glass rod.
The 1000ml measuring cylinder is taken for making up the final TBE buffer volume to 1000ml.
The 1000ml measuring cylinder is taken for Making up the final TBE buffer volume to 1000ml.
The beaker with TBE Buffer is taken from the work bench.
Entire TBE Buffer is transferred into the 1000ml measuring cylinder.
A small volume of distilled water is added into the beaker labeled as TBE buffer for dissolving all the TBE Buffer contents stuck on the sides of beaker.
The beaker is rinsed well.
The rinsed Distilled water is transferred in to the beaker.
notext
The measuring cylinder with TBE Buffer is taken from the work bench.
The final volume of TBE Buffer is made up to 1000ml with Distilled water.
The TBE buffer is transferred into a bottle which is labeled as ‘TBE Buffer’.
The 1000ml measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
After washing, the 1000ml measuring cylinder is replaced into its original place.
After washing, the 1000ml measuring cylinder is replaced into its original place.

Requirements for the Preparation of 10x TAE buffer
A spatula is taken and is wiped with cotton.
The bottle having Tris base is opened and taken out some Tris base from it.
The Tris base is put into the Blotting paper placed over the weighing balance and adjusted the weight to 48.4g.
Weighed Tris base (48.4g) is taken out from the weighing balance. After that, it is closed.
The Tris base (48.4g) is transferred into a beaker labeled as TAE Buffer for its final preparation.
A measuring cylinder of 25 ml is taken from the work bench.
A small amount of Distilled water is poured in to the measuring cylinder.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Again, small amount of Distilled water is taken from the bottle.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
The measuring cylinder is kept in the work bench.
The bottle of glacial acetic acid is opened.
11.4ml of glacial acetic acid is measured in the measuring cylinder.
The bottle of glacial acetic acid is replaced in the work bench and is closed well.
The measured glacial acetic acid is transferred into the beaker labeled as TAE buffer.
The 25ml measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
After washing, the water is removed into the sink.
A small amount of Distilled water is poured in to the measuring cylinder.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Again, small amount of Distilled water is taken from the bottle.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
The measuring cylinder is replaced into the work bench.
The bottle containing 0.5M EDTA is taken from the work bench.
20ml of 0.5M EDTA is measured in the measuring cylinder.
The EDTA bottle is replaced into the work bench.
The measured EDTA solution is transferred into the beaker labeled as TBE buffer.
The 25ml measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
After washing, the measuring cylinder is replaced into the work bench.
After washing, the measuring cylinder is replaced into the work bench.
A 1000ml measuring cylinder is taken from the work bench.
A small amount of Distilled water is poured in to the measuring cylinder.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Again, small amount of Distilled water is taken from the bottle.
The measuring cylinder is rinsed well.
The rinsed water is removed into the sink.
Approximately 600ml of Distilled water is taken into the measuring cylinder.
The Distilled water is transferred into the beaker labeled as TAE Buffer.
A glass rod is taken from the beaker.
The glass rod is wiped with cotton.
The solution in the beaker is mixed well with glass rod.
The 1000ml measuring cylinder is taken for Making up the final TAE buffer volume to 1000ml.
The measuring cylinder is kept in the work bench for making the final volume of TAE buffer to 1000ml.
The beaker with TAE Buffer is taken from the work bench.
Entire TAE Buffer is transferred into the 1000ml measuring cylinder.
A small volume of Distilled water is added into the beaker labeled as TAE buffer for dissolving all the TAE Buffer contents stuck on the sides of beaker.
The beaker is rinsed well.
The rinsed Distilled water is transferred in to the beaker.

The Measuring cylinder with TAE buffer is taken from the work bench.
The final volume of TAE Buffer is made up to 1000ml with Distilled water.
The TAE buffer is transferred into a bottle which is labeled as ‘TAE Buffer’.
The 1000ml measuring cylinder is washed under tap water.
After washing, the 1000ml measuring cylinder is replaced into its original place.
After washing, the 1000ml measuring cylinder is replaced into its original place.
All these prepared buffers and EDTA solutions are needed to be sterilized for further use.
